meanings.definition: An underground reservoir for storing water.
meanings.sent1: The old town had a cisterna to collect rainwater for the dry season.
meanings.sent2: The workers dug a cisterna to ensure they had enough water during the summer.
meanings.sent3: The cisterna in the garden was so big, it could probably hold a swimming pool!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a cisterna of memories, each drop representing a moment in time.
meanings.sent5: The cisterna gleamed in the sunlight, a hidden treasure beneath the ground.

meanings.definition: A fluid-filled sac in the body, such as the cisterna chyli in the lymphatic system.
meanings.sent1: The doctor pointed out the cisterna chyli on the diagram of the human body.
meanings.sent2: The cisterna in the lymphatic system helps transport important fluids throughout the body.
meanings.sent3: When she laughed too hard, she imagined her cisterna chyli bouncing like a water balloon.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt like a cisterna chyli, filled with emotions waiting to overflow.
meanings.sent5: The cisterna chyli was like a gentle river, carrying life-giving nutrients to every cell.
